body:
SLF Update:

Hi everyone!

Right now I am working on another chapter of Nearly Always Right and hunting down a DHP1 interview with David and Natalia.

But my ask box is open now and I’m taking requests! I’m open to one shots, headcanons, and Character Playlists! 💚

(Fandoms I’m familiar with include Harry Potter/Fantastic Beasts, Stargate/SGA, John Carter, Hunger Games, the Chronicles of Narnia, Lunar Chronicles, Jane Austen, Avengers/Marvel, PIrates of the Caribbean, Lord of the Rings, Doctor Who (Drs. 9, 10, 11), The Fifth Element, and TRON: Legacy)

blog.name: accio-shitpost
blog.title: shitpost managed
blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

blog.name: bitingdownpromo
blog.title: Biting Down
blog.description: The year is 2027. The wizarding community is tearing itself apart as danger lurks around every corner; the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power. Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance?

summary:
the electronics of your heart...
 The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in...
caption:
the electronics of your heart…

The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in squib births, the wizarding world is tossed into chaos concerning the loss of magical heritage. The renegades vow to protect what’s left of magical blood without caring about the damage along the way. More and more wixen go missing, including the Weasleys’ own Dominique. The Ministry fights within itself as Percy Weasley and Hermione Granger battle for the position of Minister of Magic, tearing the fabric holding wizarding society together.

see how fast they fall apart…

Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance? Whether you flee or bite down and take the heat, the next great war is coming and the outcome is up to you. Welcome to Biting Down.

home | plot | rules | wanted connections | character suggestions | application

Our roleplay currently has many canon characters available, such as Victoire Weasley, Freddie Weasley, James Potter, Scorpius Malfoy, and both Scamander twins. We also welcome original characters, with lots of surnames available from canon!

summary:
PROTEGO. is a post-potter HP site set in the year 2026.

 Muggleborns are dying, escaped prisoners are careening through the...
caption:
PROTEGO. is a post-potter HP site set in the year 2026.

Muggleborns are dying, escaped prisoners are careening through the streets - even the terrifying dementors have been let loose among the masses. Even those who believed themselves to be safe are no longer, and the lines between good and evil are being blurred. Who do you want to be?

Join us! we’re 6 months old and a lot of canon characters and face claims are still available, we also just released a brand new custom skin and site-wide event, we would love to see you around!

blog.description: An automated feed for the Tom/Harry and Voldemort/Harry AO3 tags. Not a fic recs blog.

title: A Dragon's Call
description:
by TosMichiyo

Graduation, a day to be remembered. When Harry Potter graduates from Hogwarts he makes a choice to leave the life he had behind forever. When he turns into his newfound dragon form, he doesn’t know yet that it will capture the attention of someone he admires, or more like obsesses about, from afar.

Tom Riddle, the Minister of Magic, is all too willing to give Harry Potter a life worth living.

Words: 10961, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Harry Potter - J. K. Rowling
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Harry Potter, Tom Riddle, Severus Snape
  • Relationships: Harry Potter/Tom Riddle
  • Additional Tags: rose potter - Freeform, Harry has a little sister, Harry Has Issues, Alternate Universe - No Voldemort, Minister for Magic Tom Riddle, Obsessive Harry, Character Death, Dragon!Harry, dragon!tom

blog.name: nillegible
blog.description: Hello, I'm Nils (Nillegible on AO3). I write mostly Naruto and Harry Potter fic, go ahead and submit prompts if you'd like me to write you a story.

tags: narcissa can't declare a vendetta for regulus' death
because it points at her own family
body:
one’s own blood

They don’t let just anyone into Azkaban, to visit the inmates. The fact that her husband had (tragically, quite regretfully the ministry had assured her) been imperiused onto the Dark Lord’s side in the war should have made it near impossible.

It takes her three years but she gets there anyway.

Azkaban is filthy and disgusting, and the Dementors hovering close feel like slimy tendrils of grief trailing over her soul. She grits her teeth and tilts her chin up and pretends not to notice the ministry escort’s whimpering as they walk down the dank, dimly lit corridors.

Narcissa has come here for the answer to one question only, and she approaches Sirius first. He looks up at her, and his face is gaunt and sunken, teeth yellowed, but his eyes, his eyes are bright with fury.

Even Azkaban could not cow Sirius Black, apparently. No wonder the boy had been sorted Gryffindor. “What happened to Regulus?” she asks, quietly,meeting Sirius’ eyes evenly. (Narcissa has looked a real madman in the red, snake-like eyes, with her precious newborn son in her arms, while Lucius crowed about raising him properly for the Dark Lord’s service. Sirius does not scare her in the least.)

But Sirius closes his eyes, and slumps, dropping his head. “Stupid brother, stupid stupid brother,” he’s muttering, and Narcissa snaps, “What did you do to him?”

“I didn’t…I looked for him, Cissy. Last two years, everywhere I could. Hoped he was hiding. He’s dead, isn’t he?”

“He is,” she says, watching him closely. “Before the war ended.”

He laughs, hollow and cracked, and the black stones absorb the strange sound, laughter born of an expected grief that still cut as deep. “I spent half my time with the order looking for him. It’s probably why they assumed I was a Death Email without the trial.”

“You betrayed Lily and James Potter to you-know-who!” The short ministry escort blusters. Sirius shoots him a look like he’s a bug, then looks to her.

“Who killed him?”

She shakes her head, as though she does not know.

“What a lovely side you picked, Narcissa. My poor fool of a brother. He probably didn’t even expect it when Voldemort ordered him killed.”

“That’s enough,” her escort snaps.

“Yes, quite,” she says, sounding disinterested, and stepping back. Doesn’t voice the, ‘Well your side has sent you here to rot,’ that won’t help in any way.

Her heart is pounding in her throat though. It wasn’t Sirius, she was almost certain now. Which meant it had been…

“Shall we proceed to Ms.Lestrange’s cell, Mrs. Malfoy?” he asks, stepping too close to her while trying to put some distance between himself and the nearest Dementor.

“Peter Pettigrew was the traitor, he’s a rat animagus,” Sirius calls as she leaves. “I suggest you buy Draco a cat.”

She turns sharply but her cousin’s looking away now, eyes glazed over.

When she asks Bellatrix, her sister just laughs, loud and mad and mocking, and Narcissa walks away before she can collect herself.

She’d wanted to know who had taken Regulus’ life, wanted vengeance against their bloodline. But when she’d cast a blood-spell seeking the identity of her cousin’s killers, it had led back to herself and Draco, to mad Aunt Walburga, and two threads almost twined together, pointed towards the sea.

She’d come here to ask which of you did it, and now she knows. She steps elegantly into the small boat and looks away from the bumbling fool who loses his footing trying to climb in after her. The pale sun brightens the further they get from the island, but there are fingers, vice-like, squeezing Narcissa’s heart, and no amount of distance between her and that accursed island convinces them to let her go.

reblog.comment:
one’s own blood

They don’t let just anyone into Azkaban, to visit the inmates. The fact that her husband had (tragically, quite regretfully the ministry had assured her) been imperiused onto the Dark Lord’s side in the war should have made it near impossible.

It takes her three years but she gets there anyway.

Azkaban is filthy and disgusting, and the Dementors hovering close feel like slimy tendrils of grief trailing over her soul. She grits her teeth and tilts her chin up and pretends not to notice the ministry escort’s whimpering as they walk down the dank, dimly lit corridors.

Narcissa has come here for the answer to one question only, and she approaches Sirius first. He looks up at her, and his face is gaunt and sunken, teeth yellowed, but his eyes, his eyes are bright with fury.

Even Azkaban could not cow Sirius Black, apparently. No wonder the boy had been sorted Gryffindor. “What happened to Regulus?” she asks, quietly,meeting Sirius’ eyes evenly. (Narcissa has looked a real madman in the red, snake-like eyes, with her precious newborn son in her arms, while Lucius crowed about raising him properly for the Dark Lord’s service. Sirius does not scare her in the least.)

But Sirius closes his eyes, and slumps, dropping his head. “Stupid brother, stupid stupid brother,” he’s muttering, and Narcissa snaps, “What did you do to him?”

“I didn’t…I looked for him, Cissy. Last two years, everywhere I could. Hoped he was hiding. He’s dead, isn’t he?”

“He is,” she says, watching him closely. “Before the war ended.”

He laughs, hollow and cracked, and the black stones absorb the strange sound, laughter born of an expected grief that still cut as deep. “I spent half my time with the order looking for him. It’s probably why they assumed I was a Death Email without the trial.”

“You betrayed Lily and James Potter to you-know-who!” The short ministry escort blusters. Sirius shoots him a look like he’s a bug, then looks to her.

“Who killed him?”

She shakes her head, as though she does not know.

“What a lovely side you picked, Narcissa. My poor fool of a brother. He probably didn’t even expect it when Voldemort ordered him killed.”

“That’s enough,” her escort snaps.

“Yes, quite,” she says, sounding disinterested, and stepping back. Doesn’t voice the, ‘Well your side has sent you here to rot,’ that won’t help in any way.

Her heart is pounding in her throat though. It wasn’t Sirius, she was almost certain now. Which meant it had been…

“Shall we proceed to Ms.Lestrange’s cell, Mrs. Malfoy?” he asks, stepping too close to her while trying to put some distance between himself and the nearest Dementor.

“Peter Pettigrew was the traitor, he’s a rat animagus,” Sirius calls as she leaves. “I suggest you buy Draco a cat.”

She turns sharply but her cousin’s looking away now, eyes glazed over.

She’d wanted to know who had taken Regulus’ life, wanted vengeance against their bloodline. But when she’d cast a blood-spell seeking the identity of her cousin’s killers, it had led back to herself and Draco, to mad Aunt Walburga, and two threads almost twined together, pointed towards the sea.

She’d come here to ask which of you did it, and now she knows. She steps elegantly into the small boat and looks away from the bumbling fool who loses his footing trying to climb in after her. The pale sun brightens the further they get from the island, but there are fingers, vice-like, squeezing Narcissa’s heart, and no amount of distance between her and that accursed island convinces them to let her go.

blog.name: accio-shitpost
blog.title: shitpost managed
blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

summary: every time i watch the later harry potter films i like to play a little game where i get increasingly annoyed at all the scenes...
body:
every time i watch the later harry potter films i like to play a little game where i get increasingly annoyed at all the scenes they cut that would have helped the movies be more coherent and yet they still had time for the scene where ginny ties harry’s shoelaces

the loser of this game is me, always

summary: So on ABC Classic FM the score for Pirates of the Caribbean was ranked higher than Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s stone and...
body: So on ABC Classic FM the score for Pirates of the Caribbean was ranked higher than Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s stone and now my brother is relentlessly teasing me about it and oh the shame someone help
